poem:
Isolation

In the quiet, shadows stretch  
where voices once mingled—  
a soul, expelled,  
wanders the edges,  
untethered.  
  
Pain threads through silence,  
questions hanging in the air—  
if only, if only  
someone had reached  
as darkness descended,  
woven decay  
into congregation.
